revised_title: Observations of Parelii and Parhelia by Stephen Gray
tldr: In 1699, Stephen Gray observed a phenomenon called Parelii, which he later identified as Parhelia or "Mock Suns." He described the appearance of these phenomena and their relationship to the sun and the laws of refraction and reflection. Gray's observations were similar to those made by Des Cartes in 1629, who also explained the occurrence of Parhelia.
scientific_discipline: Environmental and Earth Sciences > Atmospheric Science
